products.title: 3 Month | Deluxe Coffee | Gift Subscription
products.body_html:
Looking for a life-changing gift? Well, hello! 

Pay once today and your recipient will receive 3 monthly deliveries (~ 3 months) of Deluxe Subscription Coffees. 

Includes FREE SHIPPING within the US.

FAQS

  • How do I make sure it gets to the recipient
    Simply add in their details in the shipping area at checkout including their email (if you'd like them to receive tracking information).
  • What coffees will I get?
    Deluxe category coffees from our subscription program, with access to exclusive online releases.
  • When will my order ship?
    Your first order ships today, then in the first week of every month.
  • When will I be charged?
    Now, at checkout. At the end of the subscription (3 deliveries) you will NOT be charged again.
  • What does Free Shipping include?
    This product qualifies for free standard shipping with USPS.
    What size is the tin?
    Tins are 100G. 
  • Will I get the same coffee twice?
    No, a different coffee is released each month
  • Can I cancel or get a refund on Gift Subscriptions?
    No, Gift Subscriptions cannot be cancelled or refunded
  • Can I pause my subscription?
    Yes, login here once you've purchased

products.title: 12 Month | Wild Coffee | Gift Subscription
products.body_html:

Pay once today and your recipient will receive 26 bi-weekly deliveries (~ 12 months) of Wild Coffee. 

Includes FREE SHIPPING within the US.

FAQS

    Simply add in their details in the shipping area at checkout including their email address (if you'd like them to receive tracking information).

    Now, at checkout. At the end of the subscription (26 deliveries) you will NOT be charged again.

    Bags are 250g. For 500g & 1KG options, you'll get 2-4x 250g of the same coffee. Mixes of wild coffee releases aren't available, sorry!

    Possibly, we rotate through two wild coffees, with new releases every 3-5 weeks.
  • Can I cancel or get a refund on Gift Subscriptions?
    No, Gift Subscriptions cannot be cancelled or refunded
  • Can I pause my subscription?
    Yes, login here once you've purchased

products.title: Curious Coffee Subscription
products.body_html:
Feeling adventurous? Are you keen to explore new flavor trails? If the answer is yes, then you’re feeling Curious.

Subscribe to Curious and receive the very best Proud Mary Curious coffees. Choose the amount you need, and how often you'd like to get it, and leave the rest to us!

Includes FREE SHIPPING within the US.

FAQS

  • What coffees will I get?
    Curious category coffees from our rotating offer, with access to exclusive online releases.
  • When will my order ship?
    Your first order ships today, then on Tuesdays ongoing.
  • When will I be charged?
    Your first order will be charged straight away, then Saturdays ongoing.
  • What does Free Shipping include?
    This product qualifies for free standard shipping with USPS.
  • What size are the bags?
    Bags are 250g. For 500g & 1KG options, you'll get 2-4x 250g of the same coffee. Mixes of curious coffee releases aren't available, sorry!
  • Will I get the same coffee twice?
    Possibly, depending on your order frequency. We rotate through two curious coffees, with new releases every 3-5 weeks.
  • Can I pause my subscription?
    Yes, login here once you've purchased

If there are any other queries in relation to coffee, brewing or delivery services please don't hesitate to contact us on our webchat or at online@proudmarycoffee.com.au

Not ready to subscribe? That's okay! Check out our Curious collection.

products.title: LIMITED | PANAMA | Finca Momoto | Maragogipe | Natural
products.body_html: Founded in 2015 by Aliss Hartmann, Finca Momoto is a new branch on the storied Hartmann family tree. Aliss and her four siblings grew up at Finca Hartmann, playing amongst the coffee trees and climbing on bags of stored parchment at the mill. As adults, the Hartmann children each took roles at Finca Hartmann – Aliss managing the administrative side of the business. As her own children, Giuliana and Giuseppe grew up, she wanted them to have a similar childhood to hers. She purchased Finca Momoto to teach them the value of the land, respect for nature, and to share with them the same love and passion for coffee that her parents shared with her. Aliss applies an environmentally sustainable approach to coffee production, with most of the coffee from Finca Momoto processed using the natural method, eliminating the need for significant water usage. While Finca Momoto may be known for Geisha, Aliss also grows several other varieties on the farm, including Typica, Caturra, and Maragogipe. This Maragogipe lot was naturally processed and highlights the unique nuance of the variety.

products.title: LIMITED | ECUADOR | Finca Soledad | Typica Mejorado | Washed
products.body_html:
Fifteen years ago, José “Pepe” Jijón’s life was very different indeed. In 2010, he decided to settle down and reconnect with the natural beauty of his homeland, purchasing Finca Soledad—a 120-hectare farm high above the Intag Valley in northern Ecuador, near the Colombian border. 

In his younger years, Pepe traveled the world working as a mountaineering guide and became the first Latin American to climb all Seven Summits—the highest mountains on each continent. 

Finca Soledad sits high in the Ecuadorian Andes. Now beautiful and lush, the area was previously a victim of mining operations and heavy deforestation. Pepe and the team at Finca Soledad, including his father and his son, José, have been working to restore the land to its natural state and have replanted over 25,000 trees. Pepe employs a biodynamic approach to farming at Soledad—a holistic, regenerative, and organic method of agriculture that views the farm as a living ecosystem, utilizing feedback from each part of the system to determine what the farm needs. 

Originally a much larger operation, today, Pepe has focused his coffee production on a small 4-hectare section of the farm, growing unique varieties such as Geisha, Sidra, and Typica Mejorado—a little-known variety believed to be native to Ecuador. Current research suggests it’s a cross between an heirloom Ethiopian variety and Bourbon. Pepe has long cultivated this variety, and with its exceptional quality, it has become a favorite in many world coffee competitions. 


How to Drink: Just like you wouldn't add soda to your best whiskey, this amazing coffee is meant to be drank black with no sugar or cream.

products.title: HONDURAS | Nahun Fernandez | PIXI DUST | Natural
products.body_html:
Our relationship with Nahun Fernandez began all the way back in 2012. We were young and scrappy – only 3 years old, sourcing and roasting the best coffees we could find, for our customers in Melbourne, Australia. Nahun was also young and scrappy – growing and processing the best coffees he could. That introduction, all those years ago, has led to a relationship that’s blossomed over the years. We’ve experienced a lot together – both good and bad – growth, new farms and family members, expanding to Portland and then Austin, new varieties and processing techniques, rebuilding after hurricanes and a pandemic. It hasn’t always been easy – the best things never are – but our commitment to buying as much of Nahun’s coffee as possible, and his commitment to quality, have never wavered.  

It’s with that in mind, that we’re introducing a new Limited Edition Premium blend; Fairy Dust. Composed of three different naturally processed coffees from Nahun – Pacas, Catuai, and a little Geisha sprinkled in, to work its magic – this blend allows us to honor our commitment to Nahun, by finding new ways to support him.

products.title: BRAZIL | Fazenda Coqueiro | Yellow Catucai | Fermented Natural
BRAZIL | Santa Clara | Red Catucai | Natural
BRAZIL | Racho Sao Benedito | Red Catucai | Pulped Natural
COLOMBIA | Decaf - EA | Castillo & Caturra | Washed
products.body_html:
Located in southwestern Colombia, Huila is nestled between the Andes' Central and Eastern ranges, with the middle area called the Magdalena Valley. The variation in elevation results in Huila being one of the country's most unique and complex regions of coffee production. The most impressive quality behind the coffees coming out of Huila lies in the people producing them. While Huila accounts for nearly 20% of the country's production, 80% of coffee producers operate on less than three hectares.  

This coffee is decaffeinated using a natural ethyl acetate (EA) process. EA is a naturally occurring ester found in bananas and fermented sugarcane used as a solvent to remove caffeine from green coffee. The beauty of the EA process is that it helps preserve most of the original flavors of the coffee while adding fruity notes and some complexity to the cup. This coffee has notes of orange, stone fruit, malt, a soft acidity, and a long aftertaste. It's definitely not your regular decaf!

products.title: BURUNDI | Bahire | Bourbon | Natural
BRAZIL | Rio Brilhante | Topázio | Natural
BRAZIL | Mantiqueira | Yellow Bourbon & Yellow Catuai | Natural
products.body_html: Coffee has been produced on the slopes of the Mantiqueira mountains for over 100 years, and the Mantiqueira de Minas micro-region is currently among Brazil's most awarded. Mantiqueira de Minas received its Geographical Indication in 2011, recognizing the region's reputation for producing high-quality coffee with unique characteristics. This lot comprises the production of Álvaro Coli, José Wagner, and Mariana Junqueira, three of our long-term partners. Each coffee was selected for its consistent flavor profile and the producers' commitment to safeguarding a sustainable future for the region. This coffee is sweet and balanced with heaps of sugar-browning and soft fruit notes. It tastes like being wrapped in a cozy blanket.

products.title: LIMITED | MEXICO | Finca Las Nieves | 1st Place Cup of Excellence | Geisha | Natural
products.body_html:
The town of San Juan, and micro-region of Oaxaca de Juárez, were once a thriving coffee-growing region with close proximity to Puerto Escondido (now a world class surfing destination) and high elevation provided by the Southern Sierra Madre Mountains. The region seemed to have all the elements necessary for success. However, declining coffee prices and the remoteness of the region led to many farms being broken up, neglected, or entirely abandoned. Finca Las Nieves, founded in 1880, was one of these farms – until 2006 when a group of producers established a new cooperative on the land.  

Over the last eighteen years, the farm has slowly been turned around, using organic farming practices and an equitable pay structure for all cooperative members and employees. Finca Las Nieves is completely off the grid, with all its energy coming from solar, hydro-electric, and biodiesel sources. A variety garden provides all the diversity anyone could ask for, including; Geisha, Typica, Pacamara, SL28, and many more. This naturally processed Geisha scored an incredible 91+ points in the 2023 and 2024 Mexico Cup of Excellence Competitions, securing a Presidential Award along with First Place honors in both years. This is our second year purchasing this stunning coffee through the COE auction, and we couldn’t be happier to see it return.  

How to Drink: Just like you wouldn't add soda to your best whiskey, this amazing coffee is meant to be drank black with no sugar or cream.

products.title: KENYA | Kii Factory | SL 28 & SL34 Peaberry | Washed
products.body_html:
A Peaberry is the result of a natural mutation in the coffee cherry. Typically, two seeds develop inside each coffee cherry, each with one flat side and one rounded side – peaberries however, only have a single round seed. The peaberry mutation occurs in about 5% of all coffee. Many people search out these smaller, denser, and rounder beans because they’re thought to have a sweeter and more complex flavor profile. 

Kii Factory is one of three owned and operated by Rungeto Farmers Cooperative Society (FCS). Rungeto has over 850 members, many of whom deliver cherry to Kii. The factory itself was constructed in 1995, nestled at the foot of Mt. Kenya. The Kii River (fed by the snow run off from Mt. Kenya), which runs nearby, gives the factory both its name and clean water for washing coffee. As with many Kenyan coffees, meticulous detail is largely responsible for the quality of the coffee processed at the Kii Factory. Coffees are sorted upon arrival, to ensure only dense, ripe cherries are accepted. After arrival the coffee is then pulped and fermented for 16-24 hours. From the fermentation tanks, coffees are washed and then soaked for 12 hours, before heading to the drying beds. Many believe that this final soaking phase is what helps to amplify the bright, juicy acidity of Kenyan coffees.

products.title: 15 Year Anniversary Tote
products.body_html: Birthdays are for celebrating. We're turning 15 and we couldn't have done it without you! Up for grabs in one of only a few commemorative totes - screen printed right here in the US.

products.title: xBloom Studio
products.body_html:
Meet xBloom Studio, the ultimate machine for specialty coffee. With a grinder, brewer and scale seamlessly integrated in one design, its unparalleled intelligence and versatility bring magic to every brew.

Professionally curated xPods

xBloom is dedicated to finding the best coffee roasters in the world for our customers to savor. We consistently go out of our way to discover, source, and taste new coffees; and add the best to the xBloom marketplace.

Perfect crafted recipes

Every xPod comes with an electronic brew recipe card, dialed in by the roaster using an xBloom machine

Product Specs

  • Color: Midnight Black 
  • Dimensions (L/W/H) 170 x 204 x 426 mm 
  • Water Tank: 946 ml  
  • Water line connection: Yes
  • Cord length: 1000mm 
  • Main Materials: Food-grade plastic & silicone (BPA-free), stainless steel, aluminium
  • Net weight: 5.1 kg 
  • Power: 220V-240V～ | 50Hz /60Hz | 1200W
  • Connectivity: Bluetooth 5.0

products.title: PROUD MARY SPECIALTY INSTANT COFFEE | WILD | BANKO GOTITI
products.body_html:
Proud Mary Instant Coffee. There's instant coffee and then there's what's in this box - outstanding, 'what the?!...this is instant?' instant. Our version is where high-quality, thoughtfully sourced single-origin coffee you've come to expect from Proud Mary and life's on-the-fly coffee moments intersect.

In The Box
5 single servings of Banko Gotiti Ethiopia.

Banko Gotiti Washing Station serves as a centralized processing facility for many smallholder farmers around the small town of Gotiti. Like much of Ethiopia, the coffees are grown on small, garden-style plots with immediate family members providing the labor necessary during harvest. This natural from Banko Gotiti station is bursting with the delicate florals, jammy berries, and warming chocolates we all know and love from Yirgacheffe.

products.title: HONDURAS | Javier Fernandez | Pacas | Natural
products.body_html: Proud Mary's connection to the Santa Barbara region of Honduras began all the way back in 2012 when we were introduced to a small group of producers situated around the town of Peña Blanca, close to the shores of the stunning Lake Yojoa. More than a decade later, that group of producers has grown in number, and our relationships have deepened. Javier was one of the first producers we ever started working with. Back then, he grew traditional varieties, and only processed coffees used the washed method. Today, he is a processing master and has become a leader in his community by sharing all the techniques he has learnt. Because of this, the quality of the coffee produced in the Las Flores community has improved. When we first started working with Javier, natural processed coffees weren’t a thing in Las Flores. In 2016 the Fernandez family and Proud Mary conducted a little experiment to see what would happen. The result was delicious! What started with a single bag of naturally processed coffee has, over the years, revolutionized coffee production in and around Las Flores. This coffee is loud and vibrant, with some big fruit notes.

products.title: HONDURAS | Nahun Fernandez | Bourbon | Natural
products.body_html: Proud Mary's connection to the Santa Barbara region of Honduras began all the way back in 2012 when we were introduced to a small group of producers situated around the town of Peña Blanca, close to the shores of the stunning Lake Yojoa. More than a decade later, that group of producers has grown in number, and our relationships have deepened. Nahun was one of the first producers we ever started working with. Back then, he grew traditional varieties, and only processed coffees used the washed method. Today, he is a processing master and has become a leader in his community by sharing all the techniques he has learnt. Because of Nahun’s dedication to both quality and his community, the quality of the coffee produced in the Las Flores community has been steadily improving. When we first started working with Nahun, natural processed coffees weren’t a thing in Las Flores. In 2016 the Fernandez family and Proud Mary conducted a little experiment to see what would happen. The result was delicious! What started with a single bag of naturally processed coffee has, over the years, revolutionized coffee production in and around Las Flores. This coffee is loud and vibrant, with some big fruit notes.

products.title: HONDURAS | Nahun Fernandez - La Herencia | Parainema | Natural
products.body_html: Proud Mary's connection to the Santa Barbara region of Honduras began all the way back in 2012 when we were introduced to a small group of producers situated around the town of Peña Blanca, close to the shores of the stunning Lake Yojoa. More than a decade later, that group of producers has grown in number, and our relationships have deepened. Nahun was one of the first producers we ever started working with. Back then, he grew traditional varieties, and only processed coffees used the washed method. Today, he is a processing master and has become a leader in his community by sharing all the techniques he has learnt. Because of Nahun’s dedication to both quality and his community, the quality of the coffee produced in the Las Flores community has been steadily improving. When we first started working with Nahun, natural processed coffees weren’t a thing in Las Flores. In 2016 the Fernandez family and Proud Mary conducted a little experiment to see what would happen. The result was delicious! What started with a single bag of naturally processed coffee has, over the years, revolutionized coffee production in and around Las Flores. Nahun’s Natural Parainema is quickly becoming a mainstay on the menu for us, this year’s lot comes from La Herencia – Nahun’s farm, separate from the larger family farm, that he purchased a few years ago.
